title: Bhangra
short_description: A high-energy folk dance from Punjab, celebrated with dhols and vibrant attire during Vaisakhi.
long_description:
Bhangra is one of the most energetic and globally recognized folk dances of India. Originating in the Majha area of Punjab, it was traditionally associated with the Vaisakhi festival, celebrating the harvest. Men perform Bhangra to the beat of the Dhol (large drum), executing vigorous kicks, leaps, and body movements. 

Though initially a harvest dance, it has evolved into a staple for weddings and celebrations worldwide. The signature move is the raising of hands/shoulders to the beat and the 'Balle Balle' chant.
costume_and_makeup: Men wear a lungi (chaadra), a long shirt (kurta), and a turban (pagri). The clothes are extremely colorful.
